programme.title: EFL 14/15: Derby County v Leeds

programme.title: EFL 15/16: QPR v Middlesbrough
programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic action from the English Football League. Here, QPR host Middlesbrough in a five-goal thriller at Loftus Road in the 2015-16 season.

programme.desc: Welcome to the Sister from Another Mister: When Gemma hires Alexis to teach at her school, Tina suspects that the new teacher may not be quite who she claims to be.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Written in the Stars: Phil thinks that Gloria is upset with Jay for dropping the ball on Valentine's Day, so he convinces Jay to spice things up with a little role playing.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Wine Weekend: The family go on a wine-tasting trip, and Gloria and Mitch are invited to a party at Oprah's house - but they can't bring anyone else.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip featuring animals and food, from the always hilarious Tube that is Rude.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Old Neighborhood: Gordon visits Arvada in Colorado, where out-of-control hoarder Randy and his wife Alexa have allowed their restaurant Old Neighborhood to fall into disrepair.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Kati Allo: Gordon's in New York, where the stress of running a Greek restaurant has driven Manny and Christine to the brink of divorce, with their daughter stuck in the middle.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Love Is a Many-Splintered Thing: Bart's heartstrings are pulled once again when Mary Spuckler returns to Springfield, but he doesn't pay her enough attention.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Hardly Kirk-ing: Bart and Milhouse explore the perks of adulthood when a hair-shaving experiment leaves Milhouse looking exactly like his dad Kirk.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Celebration Experimentation: The gang persuade Sheldon to celebrate his birthday and invite a few special guests along to his party, in the 200th episode.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Application Deterioration: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard run into problems when they file for a patent. Emily reaches out to Raj after their break-up.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A Hard Jay's Night: Mitch struggles to hide his true feelings about the unflattering wedding topper that Cam's father whittled out of soap for them.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Australia: The entire family tag along as Phil fulfils his mum's wish for him to return to his roots and visit the country where he was conceived - Australia.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bath Item Gift Hypothesis: At Christmas, Leonard's hunky colleague starts dating Penny, while Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette torments everyone.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Killer Robot Instability: Kripke challenges the boys to a robot duel, while Howard is devastated when Penny finally tells him what she thinks of his chauvinism.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Friendship Algorithm: Sheldon develops a scientific procedure for making friends when he discovers that Kripke has control of a new supercomputer at the university.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Financial Permeability: When Sheldon lends Penny some money, it brings her ex-boyfriend Kurt back into her life, with negative consequences for the gang.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Spock, Kirk, and Testicular Hernia: George Sr asks Sheldon to help George Jr revise for a maths test when poor grades threaten his place on the football team.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: An Eagle Feather, a String Bean, and an Eskimo: When Sheldon gets the chance to attend a school for gifted children in Dallas, his family struggle to cope.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Way or the Highway to Heaven: The Simpsons explore three ways to enter heaven, including Ned's conversion as a trampoline salesman.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Baby You Can't Drive My Car: Marge and Homer work together at a cool tech company that makes self-driving cars. But the cars have a sinister secret app...

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Vengeance Formulation: Howard massively overcompensates for avoiding Bernadette.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gorilla Experiment: Howard and Penny are both jealous when Bernadette becomes fascinated with Leonard's physics project.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Maternal Congruence: Leonard is horrified when his mother turns up unannounced for a Christmas visit, and then he finds out that Sheldon knew about her divorce before him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Psychic Vortex: Sheldon and Raj go to a university party where Raj lusts after a girl called Abby. Leonard regrets telling Penny that he disapproves of her belief in psychics.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Cape Feare: When Sideshow Bob is released from prison after sending Bart threatening letters, the Simpsons are moved to Terror Lake under the witness relocation programme.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Goes to College: Homer has to go to university to study nuclear physics when it becomes clear that he's unqualified for his job as nuclear power plant safety inspector.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Kids Are All Fight: When Homer finds an old roll of film and has it developed, the family take a trip down memory lane to when Bart and Lisa were always fighting.

programme.title: New: Animal Control
programme.desc: Brand new series - Dogs and Chickens: US sitcom. When Emily hires expert dog trainer Roman Park to help with the kennel dogs, he ends up disrupting the office dynamics.

programme.title: America's Next Top Model
programme.desc: Lori Goldstein: The models are treated to new dos at a swanky salon in LA, but one of them leaves angry. A group photo shoot on a farm is imperilled by a pimple.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost...
programme.desc: ...Protocol: (2011) Part four of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The Impossible Missions Force fight to clear their name, while also trying to avert nuclear war. Busy, busy, busy!

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel
programme.desc: (2019) Partially animated action film based on a popular manga comic. Alita, a deadly cyborg brought back to life by a mourning scientist, sets out to discover her true identity.

programme.title: Hilary and Jackie
programme.desc: (1999) Fact-based drama about the lives of the troubled genius, cellist Jacqueline du Pr (Emily Watson) and her sister Hilary (Rachel Griffiths). With David Morrissey. Strong language.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: A Kid for Two Farthings
programme.desc: (1955) Carol Reed's charming film stars Jonathan Ashmore as a young, impressionable boy who mistakes a one-horned goat for a unicorn in London's colourful Petticoat Lane market.

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) Classic British dark comedy with Alan Bates and Denholm Elliott. An ambitious estate agent's clerk hires a toff to teach him to be posh. Couldn't possibly lead to murder, could it?

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: (1989) Star-studded tragi-comedy with Julia Roberts, Daryl Hannah, Dolly Parton and more. Six Southern belles console and cajole each other through life in a Louisiana beauty parlour.

programme.title: Moon
programme.desc: (2009) Psychological sci-fi thriller. Sam Rockwell stars as a man who lives alone on the moon overseeing a mining operation. His time's nearly done, but he's started to go a bit peculiar...

programme.title: Darkman
programme.desc: (1990) Liam Neeson and Frances McDormand star in Sam Raimi's crime-fighting action-fantasy. A scientist uses his invention to seek revenge on his attackers.

programme.title: Blade of the Immortal
programme.desc: (2017) Action adventure. Legendary director Takashi Miike's 100th film stars Takuya Kimura as an immortal samurai hired by a young woman to avenge her father's murder. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Blue Lamp
programme.desc: (1950) Gritty noir thriller from Ealing Studios. A rookie PC hunts a vicious killer across blitz-battered London. With Jimmy Hanley, Dirk Bogarde and Jack Warner as PC George Dixon.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: (1949) Drama with John Ireland. A local politician begins to lust for the kind of power he used to hold to account. He should be careful how he treats people on the way to the top...

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: (2012) Sci-fi action-adventure starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Rihanna. When aliens land spacecraft in the Pacific Ocean, only the US and Japanese navies can save Earth. Violence.

programme.title: The Creator
programme.desc: (2023) Sci-fi extravaganza starring John David Washington. An undercover operative must destroy a superweapon in a war against AI. But the superweapon looks like a little girl.

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate
programme.desc: (2019) Sci-fi action sequel with Linda Hamilton and Arnold Schwarzenegger. A factory worker is targeted by deadly robot assassins from the future. Thank goodness he's back.

programme.title: Significant Other
programme.desc: (2022) Eerie sci-fi horror-thriller with Maika Monroe and Jake Lacy. Extra-terrestrial forces derail a couple's romantic backpacking trip, but in a subtle, non-spaceship kind of a way.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: (1957) Comedy. Kenneth More stars as the perfect butler, who assumes command when he, his aristocratic employer (Cecil Parker) and his family and friends are shipwrecked on a desert island.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: (1958) Satirical, political drama with Spencer Tracy. Ruthless mayor Frank Skeffington seeks re-election for the fifth and final time. But have his old tactics run their course?

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: (1996) Blockbusting landmark sci-fi action-thriller starring Will Smith and Jeff Goldblum. A US Air Force pilot and a scientist battle aliens who are spectacularly destroying our planet.

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: (2013) Sci-fi thriller. A young programmer agrees to help a reclusive genius to test whether his lifelike android has consciousness, with dramatic results. Strong language/violence.

programme.title: Men
programme.desc: (2022) Alex Garland's graphic, gory horror with Jessie Buckley and Rory Kinnear. A traumatised woman tries to find solace in the English countryside only to encounter some very odd men.

programme.title: The Artifice Girl
programme.desc: (2022) Franklin Ritch's strikingly claustrophobic AI thriller. A man creates a virtual nine-year-old to lure online predators from the shadows. But as she learns, she becomes more real...

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel
programme.desc: (2019) Partially animated action film based on a popular manga comic. Alita, a deadly cyborg brought back to life by a mourning scientist, sets out to discover her true identity.

programme.title: Hilary and Jackie
programme.desc: (1999) Fact-based drama about the lives of the troubled genius, cellist Jacqueline du Pr (Emily Watson) and her sister Hilary (Rachel Griffiths). With David Morrissey. Strong language.
